title: Godot Engine Official
description: Godot is a 2D and 3D free and open source game engine developed by a community of contributors. It provides a huge set of common tools, so you can just focus on making your game without reinventing the wheel.

items.title: Migrating Animations from Godot 4.0 to 4.3
items.description: In Godot 4.3, a large number of animation features have been reworked since 4.0, so it's time to migrate your animations.
items.dc:creator: Silc Renew

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 beta 1
items.description: Godot 4.3 is ready for broad testing as we finalize the release.
items.dc:creator: Godot contributors

items.title: Web Export in 4.3
items.description: With single-threaded builds and sample playback, it's now easier than ever to export your game to the Web with Godot 4.3. And more!
items.dc:creator: Adam Scott

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 3.6 beta 5
items.description: This beta represents feature freeze for 3.6. We will now concentrate on bug fixing until we reach stable.
items.dc:creator: lawnjelly

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 6
items.description: The last dev snapshot for 4.3 before feature freeze is a big one after 6 weeks of work!
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Introducing Reverse Z (AKA I'm sorry for breaking your shader)
items.description: We are breaking compatibility for some custom shaders. Here is why.
items.dc:creator: Clay John

items.title: Update on the Collaboration with Google and The Forge
items.description: The collaboration with Google and The Forge has concluded successfully!
items.dc:creator: Clay John

items.title: Maintenance release: Godot 4.2.2 & 4.1.4
items.description: It's been a while since our last update for the 4.2 and 4.1 branches, but the wait should be worth it!
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Release candidates: Godot 4.1.4 RC 3 & 4.2.2 RC 3
items.description: Last round of release candidates for the upcoming maintenance releases.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: GDC 2024: Retrospective
items.description: We have returned from the Game Developers Conference (GDC) in San Francisco, so let's talk about it!
items.dc:creator: Nathalie Galla

items.title: Parallax2D Progress Report
items.description: A new node is on its way to help with parallax in 2D.
items.dc:creator: Mark DiBarry

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 5
items.description: Sneaking one more dev release in for testing before the team heads to GDC!
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Release candidates: Godot 4.1.4 RC 2 & 4.2.2 RC 2
items.description: Another round of release candidates for Godot 4.1.4 and 4.2.2, just before we head off to GDC!
items.dc:creator: Clay John

items.title: Introducing our GDC Line-up
items.description: Like we announced a while ago, the team is preparing to head over to the US for this year’s GDC. We will have a booth on the expo floor, and would love to welcome you there!
items.dc:creator: Nathalie Galla

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 4
items.description: Another 4.3 dev release means that many more fixes and improvements are on their way!
items.dc:creator: Clay John

items.title: GPU synchronization in Godot 4.3 is getting a major upgrade
items.description: Say goodbye to placing barriers, hello to the new acyclic graph
items.dc:creator: Darío Banini

items.title: Godot Does Conferences - Meet us at GDC!
items.description: We are excited to announce that the Godot Engine will attend the 2024 Game Developers Conference (March 18-22).
items.dc:creator: Godot Foundation

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 3
items.description: A month's worth of development means a lot of new features to test, such as single-threaded web exports and Wayland support!
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: January Jams
items.description: Looking back at a month of game jams, we curated a list of ten events that you might or might not have heard of before.
items.dc:creator: Nathalie Galla

items.title: Current state of C# platform support in Godot 4.2
items.description: How the transition to a unified .NET has impacted platform support, and re-adding the ability to port to mobile.
items.dc:creator: Raul Santos

items.title: Release candidates: Godot 4.1.4 RC 1 & 4.2.2 RC 1
items.description: As a double-feature release, Godot 4.1.4 and 4.2.2 are ready for testing with their respective release candidates!
items.dc:creator: Yuri Sizov

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 3.6 beta 4
items.description: Godot 3.6 is still in development, slowly but steadily! This snapshot updates toolchains for official builds and adds official Linux ARM binaries, among other improvements.
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde

items.title: Godot Rendering Priorities: January 2024
items.description: 4.2 brought a lot of improvements to Godot's renderer and ongoing work is paving the way for new features
items.dc:creator: Clay John

items.title: Dev snapshot: Godot 4.3 dev 2
items.description: After a well-deserved holiday break, the team is back on Godot 4.3 development at full speed, with over 200 improvements merged in the first 10 days of the year!
items.dc:creator: Rémi Verschelde
